alfredsnippet.snippet:
"If you calculate how long it has taken us to learn simple things, like how to grow crops and how to stack stones on top of each other for buildings, you would have to conclude that as a human race, we are not all that smart. It is an open question whether we are smart enough to survive much longer."

- Charley Reese
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - We Are Not All that Smart
